3: I think we need an evaluation of the current status, but that's not something I can decide.
Give me some time, I'll handle the talking.
Chrome, the one he needs the most right now is you.
I understand, but I have more important things to handle.
It's about Kamui and 'Tenebrion'—I have to report to the council.
Bianca, our mission is to clean up any corrupted and defected Constructs!
Kamui did not betray us!
Those are only your words! He's already corrupted by the virus, it's an insurmountable fact!
I don't have time to waste down here!
Kamui already has a solution. He hasn't shown signs of corruption, and has kept his rationality and consciousness intact. No signs of aggression were displayed as well.
As the leader of the Strike Hawk squad, I choose to believe him.
Bianca, if we keep dawdling, the other target's gonna be lost!
You have until we catch up to him, Chrome.
We only have to follow the mission instructions, Bianca. This is asking for trouble.
We might be disciplined for this!
I know, that's why I'm not fully giving him the pass... But as a leader, I know I'd do the same thing as Chrome.
Thank you, Bianca.
Tsk—
According to the geo signals, Kamui went far into the desert. We don't have much time, Karenina. Let's go.
The Purifying Force has geo info of all Constructs?
I understand your opinions on the Purifying Force—I know we're called 'hyenas who hunt their own' behind our back. But we never touch Constructs who do not pose a threat.
And, we do not normally have the authority to access locational signal data. Though it would make our missions a lot easier if we did.
Only in absolute necessity are we allowed access to such data.
No time to waste. I'll take full responsibility for Kamui's case. Gray Raven squad, you may leave now.
Commandant?!
Indeed. I worry for Kamui as well.
The guy might be an annoying airhead, but his absence is all the more audible.
And in the mission against 'Tifa', Kamui helped us out a lot as well. This is our turn to repay him.
Hey Gray Ravens, don't create extra work for us!
Gray Ravens, I'll ask for your cooperation as well.
You don't need to do this. I've already made a reasonable compromise. I will keep my end of the promise.
No, it's not that I don't trust you. But considering the part about the unknown energy, support in the scale of the Gray Raven squad is necessary.
Very well. We don't have the time for a debate anyway. Follow us if you're coming.
Karenina, let's go.
Wait, Bianca, you...!
Let's follow, then.
Commandant, we have a sufficient supply of serums now. It should be enough for the road ahead.
All in all. I'll be counting on you.
This looks like some sort of concentration zone for a certain kind of building.
There will likely be scavengers wandering around here.
If possible, we can give them a heads up. Just in case they might cause trouble for our mission.
